form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to encourage the deployment of highly efficient combined heat and power property, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Innovative Energy Systems Act of 2013 .

section.header: Investment tax credit for highly efficient combined heat and power system property

subsection.text: Clause (i) of section 48(a)(2)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking and at the end of subclause (III), by redesignating subclause (IV) as subclause (V), and by inserting after subclause (III) the following new subclause:

subclause.text: energy property described in paragraph (3)(A)(viii), and

subsection.text: Subparagraph (A) of section 48(a)(3) of such Code is amended by striking or at the end of clause (vi), by inserting or at the end of clause (vii), and by adding at the end the following new clause:

clause.text: highly efficient combined heat and power system property,

subsection.header: Highly efficient combined heat and power system property
subsection.text: Subsection (c) of section 48 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Highly efficient combined heat and power system property

subparagraph.header: Highly efficient combined heat and power system property
subparagraph.text: The term highly efficient combined heat and power system property means property at an industrial, commercial, or institutional facility comprising a system whichâ€”

clause.text: uses the same energy source for the simultaneous or sequential generation of electrical power, mechanical shaft power, or both, in combination with the generation of steam or other forms of useful thermal energy (including heating and cooling applications),
has a system design that provides an energy efficiency percentage of at least 70 percent, and
is placed in service before January 1, 2017.

In the case of highly efficient combined heat and power system property with an electrical capacity in excess of the applicable capacity, the credit under subsection (a)(1) (determined without regard to this paragraph) with respect to such property for the taxable year in which such property was placed in service shall not exceed the amount which bears the same ratio to such credit as the applicable capacity bears to the capacity of such property.

For purposes of clause (i), the term applicable capacity means 25 megawatts or a mechanical energy capacity of more than 34,000 horsepower or an equivalent combination of electrical and mechanical capacities.

subparagraph.text: The term institutional facility means a hospital or a facility of an educational organization described in section 170(b)(1)(A)(ii).
The term commercial facility shall not include any facility of a utility.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after the date of the enactment of this Act.
